In this series of notes, we will dive deeper into understanding the design of the two key components of our sequencer network: HotShot Consensus and the Tiramisu Data Availability layer. item.title: Announcing TypeScript 3.0 - TypeScript
item.description: TypeScript 3.0 is here! Today marks a new milestone in the TypeScript journey, serving JavaScript users everywhere.If you’re unfamiliar with TypeScript, it’s not too late to learn about it now! TypeScript is an extension of JavaScript that aims to bring static types to modern JavaScript.

item.title: Document your secrets, please
item.description: TL;DR env-sample-sync automates syncing .env with env.sample It&rsquo;s available here on Github. The problem If you have a look through any software or infrastructure project you&rsquo;ve worked on in the past, it won&rsquo;t take long before you come across some &ldquo;secrets&rdquo;. Secrets are how we generally refer to things like passwords, API keys, and certificates that act as &ldquo;identity&rdquo;. If you have the secret to an identity, you or your systems are assumed to have that identity.

item.title: pain.001 – blog/knowledge/iso_20022_pain_001 — evrim.zone

item.title: Compromised Microsoft Key: More Impactful Than We Thought | Wiz Blog
item.description: Our investigation of the security incident disclosed by Microsoft and CISA and attributed to Chinese threat actor Storm-0558, found that this incident seems to have a broader scope than originally assumed. Organizations using Microsoft and Azure services should take steps to assess potential impact.
